p: SeACoV reemerged in pig herds in Guangdong starting in February 2019 ( Zhou et al., 2019a), with an outbreak of diarrhea that caused the death of about 2000 pigs at another pig farm near the original farms with the first outbreaks. This strain (CN/GDLX/2019, GenBank accession no. MK651076) shared approximately 100 % nt identity with the “Farm-D” strain, and had an S gene that shares high nt identity (99.2–99.9 %) with previously reported SeACoV strains from Guangdong in 2017, but lower identity (97.5 %) with CH/FJWT/2018 from Fujian in 2018 ( Fig. 3).
